intro: Morinda guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan madder, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, followed by bright red berries. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Morinda guatemalensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
